root.title: Ottuq Dash I (е-4)
root.names: Е 4, Оттук-Даш I, Тувинская стела B
root.place: Three steles, gray sandstones found near the mountain Ottuq-Dash, the left coast of river Ulug-Kem, in 30 km below the mouth of river Elegest.
root.store: Adriyanov delivered to the Minusinsk museum on a raft across Yenisei in 1915.
root.general: 1 жол мәтін кеңінен атыздалып қашалған. Тастың бір бетіне ұзына бойы жазылған.
root.description: The stele almost square in section, the surface is roughly polished, sides are precisely angled. The inscription is cut by relief wide grooves in one line on all length of the stele. The bottom, apparently, is broken off.
root.investigation: Aspelin found in 1888 following the report of Martyanov. D.Klements made a special route of Orhon expedition, searched for the stele, but couldn't find it. The copy of the stele was made by Oshurkov in 1892 and delivered to Radloff. Investigated by W.Radloff 122 (LXXXV, figs. 1), S.V.Kiselev 498, S.E.Malov 501, H.N.Orkhun 500, etc.
